headline: The S&P 500 Falls as Tech Stocks Take It On the Chin
summary: The stock market struggled in the final session before Labor Day, as Wall Street opted to cap off August by selling highflying tech stocks.  The S&P 500 was down 0.6%.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 1.2%.

headline: Why Super Micro (SMCI) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of server solutions provider Super Micro (NASDAQ:SMCI) fell 4.6% in the morning session after the company disclosed “material weaknesses” in its financial reporting controls in a recent SEC filing.

raw.headline: Why Super Micro (SMCI) Stock Is Down Today

headline: SMCI Stock Alert: Super Micro Just Waved Another Red Flag
summary: Supermicro stock slips on renewed concerns about financial reporting controls. Here’s why you shouldn’t buy the dip in SMCI shares today.

headline: Super Micro shares dip after AI server maker flags financial control concerns
summary: In its annual report for the fiscal year ended June 30, Super Micro repeated similar statements from its May quarterly filing, adding that it was working to address the problems.  Last year, the San Jose, California-based company missed an August deadline to file its annual financial report and Ernst & Young LLP resigned as its auditor in October, citing concerns about governance and transparency.  Super Micro had filed its long-delayed annual report earlier this year.

headline: Nvidia’s Hyper-Growth Keeps Stock Valuation Out of Bubble Zone
summary: While the chipmaker’s earnings this week weren’t the blowout Wall Street was hoping for, they did show that its sales are still climbing faster than those by the technology universe more broadly.  Nvidia is expected to post revenue growth of at least 42% over the next four quarters, compared with an average of roughly 10% for the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 Index, according to data compiled by Bloomberg Intelligence.  The stock is actually getting cheaper as analysts raise their earnings estimates.

headline: Dell Falls After Reporting Tighter Profit Margins on Servers
summary: The need for computing to run AI tools has led to a sales boom for makers of high-powered servers like Dell, Super Micro Computer Inc. and Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. Investors have been concerned about the profitability of AI servers, however, which depend on expensive processors from companies such as Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc.  Dell booked $5.6 billion of AI server orders in the fiscal second quarter, which ended Aug. 1, down from $12.1 billion in the previous period.

headline: 3 Growth Companies With High Insider Ownership And 58% Earnings Growth
summary: As the U.S. stock market continues its upward trajectory, with major indices like the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average closing at record highs, investors are increasingly focused on growth opportunities amid economic data releases and inflation reports. In such a vibrant market environment, identifying growth companies with high insider ownership can be particularly appealing, as they often signal strong confidence from those closest to the business in its potential for sustained...

headline: Should You Reconsider Supermicro After Its 25% Drop and Audit Concerns in 2025?
summary: If you have been eyeing Super Micro Computer and wondering if now is the time to act, you are not alone. This stock is on everyone’s radar, and for good reason. After a meteoric 594.6% rise over the past three years, not to mention an astonishing 1,601.6% gain in five, it is impossible to ignore the long-term momentum. Yet, those big jumps are balanced by a noticeable dip in the last month, with shares slipping by 25.0%. That pullback follows recent headlines about shifting demand in the...
